db:abstract.db:para: QML frontend for QKeyEvent C++ class.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The KeyEvent QML type cannot be directly created. Objects of this type are used as signal parameters in KeyboardHandler.

db:section.db:title: accepted : bool
db:section.db:para: Setting accepted to true prevents the key event from being propagated to the item's parent.
Generally, if the item acts on the key event then it should be accepted so that ancestor items do not also respond to the same event.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] count : int
db:section.db:para: Holds the number of keys involved in this event. If text is not empty, this is simply the length of the string.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] isAutoRepeat : bool
db:section.db:para: Holds whether this event comes from an auto-repeating key.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] key : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the code of the key that was pressed or released.
See Qt.Key for the list of keyboard codes.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] modifiers : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the keyboard modifier flags that existed immediately before the event occurred.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] nativeScanCode : quint32
db:section.db:para: This property contains the native scan code of the key that was pressed. It is passed through from QKeyEvent unchanged.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] text : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the Unicode text that the key generated. The text returned can be an empty string in cases where modifier keys, such as Shift, Control, Alt, and Meta, are being pressed or released. In such cases key will contain a valid value.

db:section.db:title: bool matches(StandardKey key)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the key event matches the given standard key; otherwise returns false.
